availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Collins (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Son of David Collins and Polley Collins. Married to Lydia Collins on February 2, 1854. Father of Eliza Jane Collins, Polly Anne Collins, George Anne Collins, James Garfield Collins, and Luticia Collins. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850 and 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as private from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 108A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 68.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, John’s Creek, p. 3.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records—Microfilm (1852-1910), (Frankfort, KY: KDLA), rolls #994027-994058
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 896.
